title: The Danish Center for Strategic Research in Type 2 Diabetes
text:
This website includes details about The Danish Center for Strategic Research in Type 2 Diabetes (The DD2 Study). The intention of this website is to document the data sources used for research and to ease the day-to-day work with DD2.
To learn more about DD2 please see: https://dd2.dk/
An extensive list of scientific publications based on data from DD2 is available on the website. That said, a good place to start is the 2018 baseline paper (Christensen et al. 2018). We are currently working on an update of this paper.




References

Christensen, D. H., S. K. Nicolaisen, K. Berencsi, H. Beck-Nielsen, J. Rungby, S. Friborg, I. Brandslund, et al. 2018. “Danish Centre for Strategic Research in Type 2 Diabetes (DD2) Project Cohort of Newly Diagnosed Patients with Type 2 Diabetes: A Cohort Profile.” Journal Article. BMJ Open 8 (4): e017273. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmjopen-2017-017273.

title: Data structure
text:
DENNE SIDE SKAL GIVE ET OVERBLIK OVER DE FORSKELLIGE DATAKILDER. DER SKAL INKLUDERES NOGLE FIGURER.
DD2 is based on data from multiple sources:
(vi skal have nogle gode navne til de forskellige datakilder)

DD2 core data, i.e., data that makes the foundation of DD2

DD2 questionnaire data
Biomarker data (analysis results based on the blood and urine samples from time of enrollment)

Additional DD2 data, e.g., from additional questionnaires and/or substudies. This includes data only available through DD2, but it was not collected as part of the initial enrollment process.

IDNC
Fødselsdata

Data extracts from external data sources

DDDA (udgår)
Fodstatus
Diabase (øjenkompl.)

Danish medical registry data

SDS
DST
